glsa.title: Keepalived: Denial of service
glsa.synopsis: Keepalived uses world-writable PID files, allowing a local attacker to kill arbitrary processes.

background.p: Keepalived is a strong & robust keepalive facility to the Linux Virtual Server project.

description.p: The "pidfile_write()" function in pidfile.c in Keepalived writes PID files with insecure permissions.

impact.p: A local attacker may be able to cause a Denial of Service of arbitrary processes.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Keepalived users should upgrade to the latest version:
